_header: This book showeth to clerks mystical cunning
Title(s): Certayne Principall Questions drawen oute of Raymundes Questyonary
_description: Prologue to Certayne Principall Questions drawen oute of Raymundes Questyonary [actually a translation of Norton’s Latin Prologue to his Ordinal; cf. 6014] — twenty couplets

BodAsh1478.First Lines:
This Booke shewith to clerkes misticall commingeThis booke to
                    laymen of iustice is any mentinge…
BodAsh1478.Last Lines:
…fortune to hime shall chanceþe time & hour of small
                    Esperaunce

BodAsh1479.First Lines:
Thys bokes vnto clarkes declaryth syence great& here in laye
                    men maye increase of Iustyce geat…
BodAsh1479.Last Lines:
…good lorde lete þat daye come must hertely we desyerwe
                    trustyth to se þi glory o lorde we þe requyer
BodAsh1479.Note:
10 stanzas. Follows Norton’s Latin Prologue to the Ordinal. At the
                    beginning on f. 299v: ‘The inglyshe of thys latten’. At
                    the end: ‘thus endyth þe ordynall of Mr norton made by hym in anno
                    1477. Coppyed by Rychard Waultowne alias Walton the 20 of october anno 1565 to
                    our god gyve alle honor. finis Telos’.
